    Using the dccvalidator app in AMP-AD

    using-the-dccvalidator-app-amp-ad.Rmd

    Introduction

    The dccvalidator tool streamlines the data curation process by performing metadata validation checks before data is uploaded. It also allows contributors to submit documentation of their studies, making the data more understandable and discoverable. The dccvalidator application can be found at https://shinypro.synapse.org/users/kwoo/dccvalidator-app/.

    To use this application you must:

    1. Be logged in to Synapse in your browser
    2. Be a Synapse certified user
    3. Be a member of the AMP-AD consortium team

    Some portions of the app submit data to Synapse. This allows curators at Sage to troubleshoot issues if needed; no one outside the Sage curation team will be able to download the data.

    Instructions

    Step 1: Contact the AMP-AD data coordinating administrator

    Please contact the AMP-AD data coordinating administrator(AMPAD_SageAdmin@synapse.org) to let us know that you plan to submit data. The AMP-AD Knowledge Portal organizes data into studies, which are sets of data and metadata from a specific human cohort, model system, or other experimental unit. If you are contributing data for a new study, we will work with you to name the study and provide you with a location to which you will upload data. If you are contributing new data for an existing study, we will provide you with the location to which you will upload data. If you’re not sure whether your data should be a new study or part of an existing one, we can help you figure that out.

    Step 2: Provide documentation of the study

    Each study has accompanying documentation in the portal. If you are submitting a new study, or data for a new assay within an existing study, you will need to provide documentation about the study and of the methods you used. If you are submitting new data for an existing assay in an existing study (such as RNAseq data on additional donors), you can skip this step.

    You can submit your study and assay documentation through the dccvalidator app on the Documentation page. There must be a study description, and a description of each of the assays that were performed. These can be in a single file, or you can upload multiple files to the assay description section. .

    If you are submitting documentation for multiple studies, it should be submitted one study at a time. To acknowledge your data contribution you can upload an acknowledgement statement, and/or publication that should be referenced in publications based on secondary data use, in the study description file.

    Step 3: Prepare metadata

    Each study must include metadata that helps data users understand and reuse the data. In most cases, we will expect 4 files:

    1. Individual metadata describing each individual in the study
    2. Biospecimen metadata describing the specimens that were collected
    3. Assay metadata describing the assay that was performed. If multiple assays were part of the study, there will be one assay file for each.
    4. A manifest listing each file that will be uploaded (including raw data files as well as the metadata files above), where it will be uploaded to, and some additional metadata about the files. The parent column of the manifest should contain the synapse ID that we provided you in Step 1.

    We provide templates for all of the metadata files and the manifest within the portal: https://www.synapse.org/#!Synapse:syn18512044

    If you don’t see a template for the assay(s) in your study, please get in touch.

    Adding to an existing study

    If you are adding new data to an existing study, please create and validate a complete set of metadata. For example, if you are adding data on new donors, you should download the existing individual metadata file and add the new donors as additional rows, rather than submitting a file containing only the new donors. If you need help finding the existing metadata, please contact the AMP-AD data coordinating administrator.

    Step 4: Validate metadata

    The data validation portion of the app allows you to upload metadata files (as.csv) and the manifest (as .tsv or .txt) and view the results of a series of automated checks.

    Examples of the types of checks we perform are:

    • All required columns from the templates are present
    • Individuals and specimens have unique identifiers
    • Metadata terms conform to a controlled vocabulary where applicable

    Viewing data summary

    We provide a summary of the files you have uploaded, showing the number of individuals, specimens, and files. We visualize the data in each column by its data type to help spot unexpected missing values.

    Step 5: Contact the AMP-AD data coordinating administrator and upload data

    Once you have submitted your documentation, validated your metadata, and corrected any errors found by the validator, you are ready to submit data to Synapse. Contact the AMP-AD data coordinating administrator, who will grant you edit permissions to the Synapse folder where you can upload your data files, metadata, and any other research products you wish to share.

    Use the R, Python, or command line clients to upload the files in your manifest. The DCC team can help if you need assistance.
